addcommand.desc:
Used to add/edit a custom command that will respond with a specified string. alternatively regex can be used in place of a command to make SlugBot send a response message whenever the regex matches a members message.

The response can contain certain replacer flags that will be replaced will specific values when sent by slugbot.

Documentation on replacer flags can be found [here](guide.html#flag-replacers)

values.desc: Will overwrite its response
indicated by a string starting and ending with `/`
will be displayed when the custom command is used or the regex is matched

examples.command: !addcommand flip You flipped a coin and got ${rand:heads|tails}!
examples.desc: This will add a command that will respond with `You flipped a coin and got heads!` OR `You flipped a coin and got tails!` when the command `!flip` is used.
This will create a regex keyword match that will respond with a discord mention whenever a message contains the string `don't @ me`.

avatar.desc: Use this command to view a fullsized image of a members avatar. Use the command with no arguments to view a fullsized image of your own avatar.

values.desc: Discord username of the user to be muted
discord ID of the user to be muted
Mention member to be muted

examples.desc: This will display Tikaro's avatar.

banme.desc: Use this command to ban yourself.

commands.desc: Used to get a list of all custom commands in the server DMed to you.

deletemessages.desc: Use this command to delete messages sent by a specific member. Will not delete messages older than 2 weeks.

values.desc: Discord username of the user
discord ID of the user
Mention member
Number of messages to be deleted

examples.desc: This will delete the last 50 messages sent by Alex_.

giveme.desc: Use this command to set roles to be self-assignable or toggle self-assignable roles. Using the command with no arguments will list all self-assignable roles.

values.desc: specify to add new self-assignable role
specify to remove existing self-assignable role
Case insensitive string containing a role name. can include spaces
Discord role mention

examples.desc: This will set the role `slug` as self-assignable as long as the role exists in the server.
This will give the member the `slug` role if they don't already have it - or remove it if they do.

guildinfo.desc: Displays info about this guild - including server age, member count, and welcome message.

help.desc: Use this command to get info on how to use a specific command. Use the command with no arguments to get a link to this documentation.

values.desc: name of command to display information on

examples.desc: This will display documentation on the `giveme` command.

math.desc: Use this command to calculate the value of a mathematical expression

values.desc: A resolvable mathematical expression

examples.desc: This will get a response with the value of the expression.

names.desc: Use this command to get a list of past usernames and display names of a member. Use this command with no arguments to get a list of yourown past usernames and display names.

values.desc: Discord username of the user
discord ID of the user
discord member mention

examples.desc: This will display Tikaro's avatar.

optoutpings.desc: Use this allow users to toggle whether they receive platform pings or not.

pc.desc: Use this command to toggle your PC platform role.

permissions.desc:
Use this command to add or remove constraints on command usage.

Adding a channel constraint will mean the specified command can only be used in that channel.

Adding a role constraint will mean the specified command can only be used by members with that role.
**ADDING ROLE CONSTRAINTS WILL OVERRIDE DEFAULT PERMISSION REQUIREMENTS**.

values.desc: The name of the command you wish to set permission constraints for.
The string `score` stating that constraints on when XP is given are to be set instead.
disable the command/module.
enable the command/module.
specify that the command should be whitelisted
specify that the command should be blacklisted
specify that the permissions should be removed
A channel mention stating the command/module permissions are confined to that channel.
A role name stating the command/module permissions are confined to that role.
A user mention stating the command/module permissions are confined to that user.

examples.desc: This will whitelist the channel `#bot-stuff` for the command `!weapon` - meaning the `!weapon` command can only be used in that channel.
This will stop SlugBot from giving users XP for activity in the `#bot-stuff` channel.
This will only allow slugbot commands to be used in the `#bot-stuff` channel.

ping.desc: Use this command to get SlugBot's ping in milliseconds.

pings.desc: This will toggle whether or not you receive role pings from other members or member events.

profile.desc: Use this command to view members profiles or edit yourown. Use the command with no arguments to view yourown profile or specify a member to view their profile. Use `!profile wallpaper ` to set an image as your profile wallpaper. The `` must be a direct link to an image. Use `!profile color ` to set the general text color for your profile. `` must be a hex color code in the format of `#000` or `#000000`. Moderators can also flag profile images as inappropriate using the format `!profile <@member> flag|unflag`. A flagged profile will no longer display its wallpaper in the server the command was used in. Using the command with the keyword unflag will allow the profile to display its wallpaper again.

values.desc: Discord username of the user
discord ID of the user
discord member mention
specify to flag a profile as inappropriate
specify to unflag a profile as inappropriate
specify that you would like to change your profile wallpaper
A direct link to an image.
specify that you would like to change your profile's general text color
In hexadecimal

examples.desc: This will display Asheran's profile
This will set the text color of your profile to the color corresponding to #FFFDD0.
This will set your profile wallpaper to the linked image.

ps4.desc: Use this command to toggle your PS4 platform role.

removecommand.desc: Used to remove an existing custom command.

values.desc: Must match existing command exactly
Must match existing command exactly

examples.desc: This will remove the custom command `!ping`.

rep.desc: Use this command to view a members profile or give another member rep points.

values.desc: Discord username of the user
discord ID of the user
discord member mention
Amount of rep to give to specified member

examples.desc: This will attempt to give member Tikaro 2 rep points.

roll.desc: Use this command to get SlugBot to roll dice.

values.desc: Corresponding to the number of dice to roll
Corresponding to the type of dice to roll
Corresponding to a value to add or subtract from the total roll

examples.desc: This will roll four D6s, subtract 2, then display the outcome.
This will roll four D8s, add two D6s, add 5, then display the outcome.

setchannel.desc: Set channels for SlugBot to use. Using this command with no arguments will show information on set channels.

values.desc: Channel used for welcome messages.
Channel used for Member Event reminders and weekly score winners.
Channel used for general logging.
Channel used for mod action logging.
Channel used for the score leaderboard.
Channel used for stream notifications.
Channel used for member events.
Channel used for the slugboard.
Channel used for text channel that can only be used when a member is in a voice channel.
To reset a set channel.

examples.desc: This will set the channel the command was used in as the `welcome` channel for SlugBot.
This will unset the welcome channel, disabling any SlugBot functionality that uses the welcome channel.

setcolor.desc: Use this command to set your role color.

values.desc: The character or string that will be used as SlugBot's command prefix.

examples.desc: This will set SlugBot's new command prefix to '>'.

setrole.desc:
Set roles for SlugBot to use. `!setrole` with no arguments will show information on which roles have been set.

The `mute` role will be created and set automatically on the first use of a mute command if a role was not already set beforehand.

values.desc: Mute role (auto-generated)
Bot admin role
Role assigned to all members
Role given to weekly top ranking member
Role given to top ranking member
Role that adds members to the streamer list
PC platform role
PS4 platform role
XBox platform role
to reset the role for SlugBot
An existing role for slugbot to use

examples.desc: This will set totalTopRank to use a server role called 'Top Sleg'.
This will unset the weeklyTopRank role, disabling any SlugBot functionality that uses the weeklyTopRank role.

setwelcomemessage.desc:
Use this command to customise the welcome message sent when a new member joins the server.

Using the command with no arguments will display the current welcome message along with a demo of how it will appear when a member joins.

Documentation on replacer flags can be found [here](guide.html#flag-replacers)

values.desc: Can include replacer flags (e.g. ${member})

examples.desc: `${member}` will be replaced with the new member's display name.
This will disable showing the new member's profile with the welcome message.
This will reset the welcome message and not send a welcome message when a member joins.

slugballs.desc: Use this command to ask SlugBot a question, like a magic eight ball - only more rude.

values.desc: The question you wish to ask SlugBot

examples.desc: This will make SlugBot respond with an answer to the question.

userinfo.desc:
Example: ` ${PREFIX}userinfo Alex_ `
This will display guild info on member 'Alex_'.
Stating no member will display userinfo on the member who used the command.

xbox.desc: Use this command to toggle your XBox One platform role.

addbuild.desc: Used to add a build to your build list. Stating `soul level`, `upgrade level` and `build planner link` are optional but recommended. If a soulsplanner link is suplied, any missing data will be taken from the build directly - In most cases, a build link is all that is needed.

values.desc: Unique identifier for build.
Soul level of a Dark Souls build.
Blood level of a Bloodborne build.
Weapon upgrade level of build.
All optional parameters will be filled in with the data from build planner link.

examples.desc: This will add a build by the name of 'Vilhelm's Squire' to the build list. If a build by the same name already exists in the list, its information will be updated with the new information stated.
This will take the name, soul level, and upgrade level directly from the build linked.

allocatestats.desc: Use this command to find the optimal stat spread for a given weapon.

values.desc: Should include infusion type if desired. Spelling is lenient.
If no weapon name is given, info on all weapons will be given.
For special weapons, UPGRADE LEVELS SHOULD BE CONVERTED TO STANDARD UPGRADE LEVEL EQUIVALENTS so weapons can be compared. In the format of '+2'
If no upgrade level is given, the upgrade level of your set build will be used.
List of stat levels given in order and separated by spaces or '/'s
If no stat level is given, the corresponding stat level of your set build will be used.

examples.desc: This will disribute 40 levels across damage stats to give the most damage per R1.
This will find the optimal stats for a +7 claymore from a starting point of 16 strength and 35 dex, given 25 levels to distribute.

build.desc: Used to view your own build list or the build list of another member.

values.desc: Build number shown in member's build list.

examples.desc: This will show Tikaro's build list.
This will display the build info of Tikaro's build numbered '3'.

damagecalc.desc: Use this command to calculate the damage after defenses and absorption.

values.desc: AR of the relevant attack.
defense value of the player receiving the attack.
absorption value of the player receiving the attack.

examples.desc: This will calculate the damage received from a 500 AR weapon through 134 defense and 31% absorption.

igot.desc: Use this command to get a readout containing the estimated level of another player killed in Dark Souls 1 or Dark Souls 3.

values.desc: specify to calculate the soul level of a Dark Souls 1 player.
specify to calculate the soul level of a Dark Souls 3 player.
Corresponding to the number of souls you received when killing another player.

examples.desc:
This show the possible soul level of a player depending on their phantom type.
![igot-screenshot](images/igot_demo.png)

item.desc: Used to search items in souls games and return item descriptions.

values.desc: Limit the item search to only Dark Souls 1.
Limit the item search to only Dark Souls 2.
Limit the item search to only Dark Souls 3.
Limit the item search to only matches in the item name.
Limit the item search to only matches in the item description.
Find items relating to this search string

examples.desc: This will search for an item with 'gael's greatsword' in the name or description across all Dark Souls games.
This will search for an item in Dark Souls 1 with 'rapier' in the name.

namecheck.desc: Use this command to check if a name will be censored by the Dark Souls 3 name filters. Will also show if the name is too long.

values.desc: containing a name to check against the Dark Souls 3 name filter

examples.desc: This will test the name "Knight Plumfinger" against the Dark Souls 3 name filter - showing how the censored name will appear in game.

poise.desc: Use this command to display various poise breakpoints needed for weapon 1 to poise through the weapon 2. Use the `80` reaction to toggle between 80 and 100 poise health. Use the `2h` reaction to toggle between one handed and two handed stance for weapon 2.

values.desc: The weapon name of a specific weapon with poise attacks.
A class of weapon to get general breakpoints for that class.
The weapon name of a specific weapon. The poise damage of this weapon's attacks will be used to find the breakpoints.
A class of weapon. The poise damage of this weapon's attacks will be used to find the breakpoints.

examples.desc: This will display various poise breakpoints required for a greatsword class weapon to poise through halberd attacks.

range.desc: Use this command to find the upper and lower soul level limits for players invading you or hosts you invade.

values.desc: specify that the command is being used to find the level ranges from the perspective of the host.
specify that the command is being used to find the level ranges from the perspective of invaders/summons.
Soul level to calculate summon/invasion range for.
optional parameter for weapon upgrade level to calculate summon/invasion range for.

examples.desc: This will show the soul level ranges for multiplayer interaction for soul level 90 invaders.

removebuild.desc: Used to remove a build from a your build list.

values.desc: Number of a build in the build list

examples.desc: This will remove the build 'Vilhelm's Squire' from the build list. Build name is case insensitive.

setbuild.desc: Use this command to set your current build from your list of added builds.

values.desc: Approximate name of an added build
Number of build in your build list

examples.desc: This will set your current build to Knight Laran as long as its in your build list.

weapon.desc:
Use this command to calculate the AR of any DS3 weapon, along with the expected damage on R1s/L1s, backstabs and ripostes.

listing up to four weapons separated by `vs` will allow you to compare them. Note that the upgrade and stats need to be specified only once, and at the end.

In the case of an incomplete input, like `!weapon caestus`, the missing upgrade and stat data will be collected from the build you currently have set through the `!setbuild` command.

Typing out the command without a `[weapon name]` argument will make SlugBot calculate the ten best weapons based on expected R1 damage for the upgrade level and stats provided. The printout for this kind of input will include reactions to toggle between various weapon classes. SlugBot will also note if any of the weapons are usable only when 2-handed.

values.desc: Should include infusion type if desired. Spelling is lenient.
If no weapon name is given, info on all weapons will be given.
For special weapons, UPGRADE LEVELS SHOULD BE CONVERTED TO STANDARD UPGRADE LEVEL EQUIVALENTS so weapons can be compared. In the format of '+2'
If no upgrade level is given, the upgrade level of your set build will be used.
List of stat levels given in order and separated by spaces or '/'s
If no stat level is given, the corresponding stat level of your set build will be used.

examples.desc: The 1-hand/2-hand and weapon self-buff states can be toggled via appropriate reactions. The normal upgrade path input is used for special weapons; `!weapon black knight sword +10 20 18 10 10 10` will print out the data for a black knight sword at an upgrade level of +5.
This will compare the fire dagger and chaos dagger weapons at the given stats. Use the number reactions to view each of the given weapons.

whowas.desc:
Use this command to find the owner of a character you met in-game, along with more info on their build.

Numbered reactions 1-5 will be displayed, allowing you to select a build to preview from the list of builds with similar names to the one specified.

SlugBot will attempt to find five builds in its database with the most similar names.

values.desc: Approximate name of a character

examples.desc: This will show 5 builds from SlugBots build database that most closely match the name `Amil of the Deep`.

values.desc: Unique ID of process

examples.desc: This will activate the process with ID AL3X1 if it was suspended.

bid.desc: Uses this command to make a bid on a process in the auction.

values.desc: Process ID of auctioned process
Amount to bid for process on sale

examples.desc: This will make a bid of 1,000,000sc on the process N4RC1.

bypass.desc: Start the BYPASS process on another member.

values.desc: Discord username of the user to be bypassed
discord ID of the user to be bypassed
Mention member to be bypassed

examples.desc: This will begin the BYPASS process on user Alex_.

clean.desc: Use to remove your own processes or attempt to remove processes planted by others.

crack.desc: Start the CRACK process on another member.

values.desc: Discord username of the target user
discord ID of the target user
Mention of target user
ID of a BYPASS process on the target

examples.desc: This will begin the CRACK process on user Alex_.

daily.desc: Used to collect your daily bucket of slugs.

examples.desc: This will transfer your daily bucket of slugs if you have yet to claim it for this day.

giveslugs.desc: Transfer slugs from your balance to another user's.

values.desc: Discord username of the user to be bypassed
discord ID of the user to be bypassed
Mention member to be bypassed
Amount of slugs to give

examples.desc: This will transfer 10,000 slugs to user Tikaro.
This will start a Higher Lower game with a starting bet of 10,000sc.

hijack.help: Use to remove your own malware or attempt to remove malware planted on you.

invest.desc: Use this command to invest SC in text channels. Channel investments let you invest SC in a channel to get return payments for messages sent in that channel for 7 days. The return rates are calculated from the last 7 days activity - meaning that if a channel is more active in the following 7 days, you will see bigger returns.

values.desc: A discord channel mention
leaving blank will invest in the channel the command was used in
Specify that you are terminating an existing investment
Amount of SC to invest
Leave blank to just view return rates and investment info of the channel

examples.desc: This will attempt to invest 100,000sc in the #general text channel. A confirmation reaction must be pressed before the investment is finalised. The investment can be cancelled by clicking the cancel reaction.

This will terminate an existing investment in the #general text channel. A confirmation reaction must be pressed before the investment is terminated. The termination can be cancelled with the cancel reaction.

levelup.desc: Use this command to level up a stat.

values.desc: Level up the firewall stat
Level up the bypasser stat
Level up the encryption stat
Level up the cracker stat
Level up the scanner stat
Level up the wire stat
Level up the interceptor stat
Level up the injector stat

log.desc: View account logs of your account or an account of a user you have a TRACKER on.

plant.desc:
Attempt to plant a process on another user.
The modifier is often the potency of the process you are planting. The potency of a LEECH is how many slugs will be taken every hour.
The potency of a SKIMMER is the fraction (between 0 and 1) of Slugs that will be skimmed off every incoming transaction. The modifier of a REDIRECT is the target the malware should attempt to redirect to.

values.desc: Specifies planting SKIMMER process
Specifies planting LEECH process
Specifies planting BYPASS_VIRUS process
Specifies planting HONEYPOT process
Specifies planting REDIRECT process
Specifies planting TRACKER malware
Discord username of the target user
discord ID of the target user
Mention of target user
ID of a BYPASS process on the target

examples.desc: This will plant a SKIMMER process on Alex_ with a potency of 30%.
This will plant a LEECH process on tikaro that will leech 2500sc per hour.
This will plant a REDIRECT process on Narcolept that will redirect an incoming process to Errel.
If barry was the one using this command, it would initiate a self-scan
This will scan for all bypass processes planted by narcolept on shandra
This will scan for all skimmers owned by narcolept
This will scan for all skimmers planted on narcolept.
This will scan for a process with an ID of J4ES7.

sell.desc: Uses this command to begin an auction on the specified process.

values.desc: Process ID of auctioned process
Optional starting price of listed process. Defaults to 10,000sc

examples.desc: This will add process T1K4R to the auction at a starting price of 150,000sc where it can be bid on by other users.

shop.desc: Use this command to view the weekly public process shop.

examples.desc: Displays the global process auction where users can buy and sell processes.
This will put a 10,000sc bet on the slots.

slugs.desc:
Use this command to open your SlugCoin account menu. Use the reactions to change menu tabs, cycle process pages, and select specific processes.

Optionally specify a member you have bypassed to view their account instead.

values.desc: Discord username of the member who's account you wish to spoof.
discord ID of the member who's account you wish to spoof.
discord member mention of member who's account you wish to spoof.

examples.desc: This will open your account menu.
This will open ausi's account menu only if you have bypassed their firewall.

values.desc: Unique ID of process

examples.desc: This will suspend the process with ID AL3X1 if it was active.

takeslugs.desc: Steals an amount of SC from the target. The target's encryption must be CRACKed to be able to steal. The command must be used in a channel the target has access to.

values.desc: Discord username of the target user
discord ID of the target user
Mention of target user
ID of a BYPASS process on the target

vault.desc: Used to move Slugs from your current account into your vault.

challenge.desc: Use this command to challenge another member to a ranked fight or put out an open invitation to be challenged.

examples.desc: This will put out an open invitation
This will challenge Dashima to a ranked fight.
This will cancel your last challenge provided it was not already accepted by an opponent.

elo.desc: Use this command to view your ladder stats or the stats of another member.

examples.desc: This will display your own ladder stats.
This will display Aether's ladder stats.

ilost.desc: Use this command to declare the outcome of a challenge.

examples.desc: This will record that you claimed you lost 5 3 in your active challenge.

iwon.desc: Use this command to declare the outcome of a challenge.

examples.desc: This will record that you claimed you won 5 3 in your active challenge.

ladder.desc: Use this command reset the ladder or set the leaderboard channel.

examples.desc: This will reset all members points in the ladder.
This will set the ladder leaderboard channel to the one this command was used in.
This will set Oryx's points to 20.

iam.desc:
Use this command to create a notification for a Member Event (such as a *dry finger run*).

Provide at least a location and what you are doing there. **Passwords and character names must be in quotes.** If you have multiple platform roles, remember to state which one the event will be on. How you word it doesn't matter too much. You can add extra event information by including `info: "<extra info here>"` when using the command.

Use `${PREFIX}iam done` command to end the event.

examples.command: !iam dry fingered in the archives. soul level 81 +10. character name "The Balnace", password: "slug"
examples.desc: This will create a member Event notification in all member event channels, stating where you are, what you are doing, your soul level, upgrade level, character name, and password. You can update the information in the member event without having to re-enter everything again. Simply use the command again and specify your updates.

examples.command: !iam now SL90 at the ringed city streets.
examples.desc: This will update the soul level and location, leaving everything else unchanged.
This will end the event.

ban.desc: Use this command to ban a member.

values.desc: Discord username of the user to be muted
discord ID of the user to be muted
Mention member to be muted
Optional reason for the ban

examples.desc: This will ban Alex_ from the server.

filter.desc:
Use this command to add or remove word filters in the current server. The filter string can either be a normal string or RegEx.

When a member sends a message in the server containing the filter string, their message will be deleted, score will be deducted and there will be a random chance they will be muted. the mute chance increases each time the same member triggers the filter.

If a normal string is given, common letter substitutions will be taken into account.

if RegEx is given, the matched message will be deleted but the member will not have score deducted or have a chance to be muted.

values.desc: specify to add new filter
specify to remove existing filter
specify to list all filters
normal string containing word(s) to be filtered
Regular expression to have messages deleted when matched

examples.desc: This will make SlugBot delete any messages containing the word 'snail', deduct score from the offending member and have a chance to mute them.
This will make SlugBot delete any messages containing any digit. (check [regex101](https://regex101.com/) for RegEx syntax and RegEx testing)

mute.desc: This command is used to mute members. Giving a duration and reason are optional. Not giving a duration will mute the user until they are manually unmuted. The member can be specified by ping, user ID or name.

values.desc: Discord username of the user to be muted
discord ID of the user to be muted
Mention member to be muted
amount of time the member should be muted for
reason for why the member was muted. Will be DMed to the member

examples.command: !mute 2340287340287 1 hour 30 mins reason: For reasons and stuff.
examples.desc: This will mute the member with ID 2340287340287 for 10 minutes and DM them the reason 'For reasons and stuff'.
With no arguments given, a list showing all muted members and their remaining mute times will be shown.

unmute.desc: Use this command to unmute a muted member.

values.desc: Discord username of the user to be muted
discord ID of the user to be muted
Mention member to be muted

examples.desc: This will unmute member 'Alex_' if they are muted.

warn.desc: Use this command to record a warning for a member or remove past warnings.

values.desc: Discord username of the user to be muted
discord ID of the user to be muted
Mention member to be muted
The reason the member was warned.
Flag to specify removing a warning from a member.
Optional index of a warning. Leaving empty will remove the last warning

examples.desc: This will record a warning for Alex_ that can be reviewed with !warnlog Alex_.
This will remove the last warning given to Alex_

warnlog.desc: Use this command to view warnings given to a specified member.

values.desc: Discord username of the user to be muted
discord ID of the user to be muted
Mention member to be muted

examples.desc: This will display all past warnings given to Alex_.

poll.desc: Use this command to start a poll with the given options. If an amount of time is given in the description, that will be used as the duration of the poll. End a poll by using the `end` argument and optionally a poll message ID.

values.desc: Optional parameter to add a description to the poll message.
A label for a voting option. The prefix number must be included.
The message ID of a poll message.

examples.command: !poll Should I stream Dark Souls 1 or Dark Souls 3 today? You have 30 mins to vote! 1: Dark Souls 1 2: Dark Souls 3
examples.desc: This will create a new poll with the description of "Should I stream Dark Souls 1 or Dark Souls 3 today? You have 30 mins to vote!", with two options, that will automatically conclude in 30 minutes.
This will terminate the most recent poll started by the command user. The poll message will be edited with the final results.
This will attempt to terminate the poll with message ID 753674416801579040.

raffle.desc: Use this command to create a raffle - allowing users to enter by adding a react to the raffle message.

examples.command: !raffle start 14 This server is hosting a raffle that will end in 14 days.
examples.desc: This will create a raffle notifiction with the raffle message and a countdown for 14 days. Members can click the reaction to take part.
This will end the raffle and edit the raffle notification announcing the randomly selected winner. Use the command again to draw a new winner.
This will end the raffle, delete the raffle notification and **will not select a winner**

remindme.desc: Get SlugBot to remind you with a message after a given amount of time.

values.desc: Reminder message SlugBot will send.
a list of time values

examples.command: !remindme to do the dishes in 1 hour and 20 mins
examples.desc: This will DM you with the reminder 'do the dishes' in 1 hour and 20 minutes.

examples.command: !remindme in 5 days and 6 hours to check the mail.
examples.desc: This will DM you with the reminder 'check the mail.' in 5 days and 6 hours.

rolereact.format: ${PREFIX}rolereact create | (<msg ID> add <reaction> <role>) | (<msg ID> remove [reaction]) | (<msg ID> desc <description>)
rolereact.desc: Use this command to create a RoleReact message - allowing users to assign roles to themselves using the reactions on the message.

values.desc: specify to create a new RoleReact message
specify to add new self-assignable role
specify to remove existing self-assignable role
specify to update the RoleReact description
specify to update the embed color of the RoleReact message
The message ID of an existing RoleReact message
A default or custom emoji
The name of a role
A description to display in the RoleReact message

examples.desc: This will create a new RoleReact message.
This will add a new reaction - or update an existing one - that will give members the 'PC Player' role when clicked.
This will remove the  reaction and no longer give members any role when a  reaction is added.

examples.command: !rolereact 731977229902282773 desc Welcome to the server! Select the relevant roles for you by clicking the reactions on this message.
examples.desc: This will update the description in the message.
This will set the color of the embed white.

leaderboard.desc: Use this command to view the top 10 ranked members in the server along with the score of adjacent ranks.

values.desc: specify that the weekly leaderboard should be displayed

examples.desc: This will display the score leaderboard for the server the command was used in.
This will display the weekly score leaderboard for the server the command was used in.

rank.desc: Use this command with no arguments to view your own profile - displaying score and rank. Specify a member to view their profile.

values.desc: Discord username of the user
discord ID of the user
discord member mention
Get profile of member at specified rank. Denoted by '#' followed by rank.
Get profile of member at specified WEEKLY rank. Denoted by '##' followed by weekly rank.

examples.desc: This will display Tikaro's profile with server rank and weekly rank if applicable.
This will display the profile of the member with server score rank 2.

roleatlevel.desc: Used to specify a role to be given to members once they reach a certain level. If [remove at level] is specified, the role will be removed from members who's level is higher than the stated [remove at level] value

values.desc: Name of role that will be given when the specified level requirement is met.
Level requirement for the role to be given.
Level requirement for the role to be removed.
Specify that a notification should be sent in chat when a member reaches the level requirement.
Specify that a notification SHOULD NOT be sent in chat when a member reaches the level requirement.
If omitted, will default to 'true'.

examples.desc: This will give the role 'Trusted' to any member who reaches level 10.
This will give the role 'Trusted' to any member who reaches level 10. No chat notification will be sent.
This will give the role 'Sleg' to any member who reaches level 5 but will be removed again once they reach level 10.

weeklyscorereset.desc: Use this command to activate weekly score resets and the weekly score leaderboard.

slugboard.desc: Use this command to customise the functionality of Slug-Board.

values.desc: A number specifying the minimum needed reactions to slugboard the message.
An emoji that SlugBot will use as a slugboard flag or indicator.

examples.desc: This will set the threshold for the number of reactions needed to add a message to the Slug-Board to 4.
This will set the emoji users must react with to get a message on the Slug-Board to .
This will set the emoji SlugBot reacts with when a message is added to the Slug-Board to

jointwitch.desc: Use this command to force slugbot to join your twitch chat. You must have first linked your discord and twitch accounts using [!twitch <twitch name>]()

synctwitch.help: Sync commands and quotes with the server owner's twitch channel.

twitch.help:
Used to link a Discord account with a Twitch account.

__**Example:**__` ${PREFIX}twitch smugslugbot `
This will DM SmugSlugBot with a request to confirm the link.

streamer.desc: Use this command to add a streamer to the streams notification list or remove a streamer from the list. A notification message will be sent to the '#streams' channel (if set) when a streamer in the list goes live on twitch.tv. The notification gets deleted when the streamer goes offline again.

values.desc: specify to add streamer to list
specify to remove streamer to list
specify to list all streamers
twitch.tv username. case insensitive

examples.desc: This will add twitch streamer 'Florador' to the streams notification list.
This will remove twitch streamer 'Florador' from the notification list.
This will list all streamers currently set to display when they go live.
